Main GUI#

baecon.GUI.baecon_GUI.main()#

Main GUI for baecon.

Includes sections (i.e., nicegui.ui.cards) for the following:

  • Data format and saving

  • Loading, configuring, and controlling acquisition and scan devices

  • Loading the measurement engine

  • Saving and loading the experiment

  • Plotting the data generated from the engine

  • Editable table of the scan settings/schedule

class baecon.GUI.gui_utils.All_GUI_Elements(elements: list = <factory>)#

Holds list of all elements (i.e. cards) in the GUI. Used to update all the fields when loading experiments.

class baecon.GUI.gui_utils.GUI_fields(plot_data: dict = <factory>, scan_dev_files: dict = <factory>, acq_dev_files: dict = <factory>, exp_name: str = '', exp_file: str = '', engine_name: str = '', engine_file: str = '', scan_file: str = '', averages: int = 1, data_auto_save: bool = '', data_folder: str = '', data_file: str = '', data_file_format: str = '', data_analysis: str = '', plot_active: bool = False, abort_measurement: bool = False)#

Object holding all the fields in baecon.GUI.baecon_GUI.main().

These fields mostly correspond to file names and paths for various baecon objects, e.g. scan device file name or data file name an path.

Note

The dictionary containing the plot data is held here. This is not the full data, but a slightly reduced data set which looks good for plotting. The format of this data is defined by baecon.GUI.cards.plot_card

Todo

Should data_card be object defining plot data format?? Engine might be better for that.

class baecon.GUI.gui_utils.Holder(value: any = '')#

Used for passing values between functions and GUI inputs. NiceGUI uses lambda and async functions which can which don’t always work right for methods with arguments. This Holder helps circumvent this issue, letting methods be defined without arguments.

An alternative to this methods is to use partial from functools.

class baecon.GUI.gui_utils.Plot_Settings#

Currently not used for anything. Could hold plot formatting/setting.

These plot maybe passed to engine_card and data_card.

baecon.GUI.gui_utils.available_devices() → list[str]#

Generates a list of devices that are available in the list directorty

Returns:

List of devices available in the Devices directory.

Return type:

list[str]

baecon.GUI.gui_utils.from_gui_fields_config(config: dict, gui_fields: GUI_fields) → None#

Fills a GUI_fields from dictionary.

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Dictionary with configuration information.

  • gui_fields (GUI_fields) – Object to put dictionary info into.

baecon.GUI.gui_utils.name_from_path(file_path: str) → str#

Strips path of all directories, returning just the file name and type.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to file of interest.

Returns:

File name, including file type.

Return type:

str

async baecon.GUI.gui_utils.pick_file(directory) → str#

Opens a GUI window to pick a file.

Returns:

String/path of the file location.

Return type:

str

baecon.GUI.gui_utils.to_gui_fields_config(gui_fields: GUI_fields) → dict#
Generates a dictionary from GUI_fields.

This dictionary then defines an experiment.

Also, the plot_data field is set to an empty dictionary. We don’t want to save plot data in this configuration dictionary, the data saving is handled by Data Card.

Parameters:

gui_fields (GUI_fields) – GUI_fields object for the current GUI configuration.

Returns:

Dictionary of with the fields info from the GUI_fields object.

Return type:

dict

baecon.GUI.gui_utils.update_everything(gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#
Updates all the elements of the GUI.

For certain GUI elements not bound to one of the GUI_fields

Parameters:

  • gui_fields (GUI_fields) – _description_

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – _description_
